alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 5:50PM CDT until May 17 at 7:49AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Austin, Fort Bend, Harris, Waller and Wharton. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Katy, Sealy, Brookshire, Wallis, Fulshear, Simonton, San Felipe, Pattison, northern Weston Lakes and Cinco Ranch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
